intro: Carlowrightia lesueurii, commonly known as the Lesueur's carlowright, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
